Player¶

class source.player.Player(game, id, resources=1)[source]¶

It is the base class from which all players inherit. It implements the default compute_strategy method (as a uniform player) and the sample_strategy method.

Each subclass has class attributes (name and pattern) and a class method (parse): they are used for the parsing of the player columns in the config files.

classmethod parse(player_type, game, id)[source]¶

This is the default

compute_strategy()[source]¶

set a probability distribution over the targets default: uniform strategy

sample_strategy()[source]¶

sample a move from the computed distribution

class source.player.Attacker(game, id, resources=1)[source]¶

The Attacker base class from which all the attacker inherit: it implements the best_respond method which is used by many types of adversaries.

best_respond(strategies)[source]¶

Compute the pure strategy that best respond to a given dict of defender strategies

class source.player.StackelbergAttacker(game, id, resources=1)[source]¶

The Stackelberg attacker observes the Defender strategy and plays a pure strategy that best responds to it.

class source.player.DumbAttacker(game, id, resources=1, choice=None)[source]¶

The Dumb attacker, given an initially choosen action, always plays itp

class source.player.FictiousPlayerAttacker(game, id, resources=1, initial_weight=10)[source]¶

The fictitious player computes the empirical distribution of the adversary move and then best respond to it. When it starts it has a vector of weights for each target and at each round the plays the inverse of that weight normalized to the weights sum. Then he observe the opponent’s move and update the weights acconding to it.

compute_strategy()[source]¶

Add 1 to the weight of each covered target in the defender profile at each round: then best respond to the computed strategy

class source.player.StUDefender(game, id, resources=1, confidence=0.9)[source]¶

This defender is able to distinguish between a uniform or a stackelberg attacker and best respond accordingly

This is only an example: from our computation in fact against these two kind of adversaries there is no interests in distinguish between them: in fact playing always the best response to a stackelberg player does not generate any regret.
